subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 18, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESTexas Flooding Sweeps Away 4-Year-Old Girl
Torrential rains swamped North Texas towns, killing at least two people, prompting hundreds of evacuations and leaving numerous
                        people stranded on rooftops. Alexandria Collins, 4, died after she was swept away in floodwaters in a Fort Worth suburb. More...Watch: Rains Flood Texas Town
• Boy Killed By Black Bear In Utah• Duke And Lacrosse Players Reach Settlement
                     					| Watch• U.S. Lifts Sanctions On Some Palestinians
                     					| WatchU.S.Duke And Lacrosse Players Reach Settlement
Duke University says it has reached an undisclosed financial settlement with three former lacrosse players falsely accused
                        of rape. More...Watch: Duke Victim's Lawyer On Nifong
• Pregnant Mother Goes Missing In Ohio
                     					| Watch• Boy Killed By Black Bear In Utah• Police Probe Drag Racer's Deadly Burnout
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldSurvey: Sudan, Iraq Most Unstable Nations
The annual "Failed States Index," which measures the stability of countries relative to social, economic, political and military
                        indicators, found two nations (whose success is important to the Bush administration) mired in the 10 worst.  More...
• Pakistan Condemns Rushdie Knighthood• 100 Killed In 3 Days In Afghanistan
                     					| Watch• U.S. Lifts Sanctions On Some Palestinians
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsMcConnell: Immigration Too Close To Call
The Senate's top Republican said he could not predict whether the stalled immigration reform bill will pass, citing questions
                        among conservatives as to whether it guarantees amnesty to illegal immigrants. More...Watch: Face The Nation, 06.17.07
• Agreed: Something Needs To Change In Iraq
                     					| Watch• President Bush And The National Debt• Romney Surges Ahead In Bellwether States
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealth111-Year-Old Cited As World's Oldest Man
Tomoji Tanabe, at age 111 the world's oldest man, keeps a daily diary, drinks milk and stays away from alcohol and smoking. More...
• A Pill To Forget?
                     					| Watch• A Lyme Disease Warning From The CDC
                     					| Watch• Is America Too Sweet On Sugar?• More StoriesSciTechOil Industry Scales Back Expansion Plans 
A push from Congress and the White House for huge increases in biofuels, such as ethanol, is prompting the oil industry to
                        scale back its plans for refinery expansions. That could keep gasoline prices high, possibly for years to come. More...
• Space Station's Computers Seem A-OK• Wireless Technology Takes A Leap Forward• Massive Global Pedophile Ring Busted
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessFormer Enron Broadband Exec Sentenced
The former chief of Enron Corp.'s high-speed Internet unit, who turned government witness and testified in the trial of former
                        Enron CEO Jeffrey Skilling and company founder Kenneth Lay, was sentenced to 27 months in prison. More...
• Airbus Makes A Splash With US Airways• Dubai Company Buys QE2 Ocean Liner • NASCAR Countersues AT&T For $100M• More StoriesEntertainmentJulia Roberts Welcomes A Son
Actress Julia Roberts gave birth to her third child, Henry Daniel, on Monday in Los Angeles. More...
• A Weekend Of Visitors For Paris
                     					| Watch• Britney To Clear Channel: I'll Sue You!• Beckham Nearly Gets Hollywood Ending• More StoriesOpinionFatah's Fall
The New Republic says that with the rise of Hamas in Gaza, the Bush administration must alter its tactics and make
                        a more concerted effort for peace in the Middle East.  More...Watch: Escaping Hamas-Ruled Gaza
• Lieberman Takes Heat For Iran Warnings
                     					| Watch• Andy's Personality Quiz
                     					| Watch• Maybe There Should Be A Third Party
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Pregnant Mother Goes Missing In Ohio
Jessie Mudle Davis, who is nine months pregnant, was last heard from June 13. She spoke to her mother on the phone, but after
                        that, Davis, who has a 2-year-old son, vanished. More...Watch: Pregnant Woman Missing

Cops Probe Dragster DeathsPolice are investigating how a Tennessee parade ended in tragedy when pro drag racer Troy Critchley lost control of his car
                                    and plowed into a crowd of spectators. Drew Levinson reports.
